title: 5. Error Handling & Resilience
content:
Implement Retry Policies (10 phÃºt) Enhanced Retry Configuration ChÃºng ta sáº½ cáº£i thiá»‡n retry policies Ä‘á»ƒ handle different types of errors:
{ "Retry": [ { "ErrorEquals": ["States.TaskFailed", "Lambda.ServiceException"], "IntervalSeconds": 5, "MaxAttempts": 3, "BackoffRate": 2.0, "Comment": "Retry for service exceptions with exponential backoff" }, { "ErrorEquals": ["States.Timeout"], "IntervalSeconds": 10, "MaxAttempts": 2, "BackoffRate": 1.5, "Comment": "Retry for timeout errors with longer intervals" }, { "ErrorEquals": ["Lambda.Unknown"], "IntervalSeconds": 2, "MaxAttempts": 5, "BackoffRate": 1.2, "Comment": "Retry for unknown Lambda errors" } ], "Catch": [ { "ErrorEquals": ["States.ALL"], "Next": "HandleFailure", "ResultPath": "$.error", "Comment": "Catch all unhandled errors" } ] } Error Classification Retryable Errors:
Network timeouts Service temporarily unavailable Rate limiting Transient AWS service issues Non-Retryable Errors:
Invalid configuration Permission denied Resource not found Invalid input parameters Custom Error Handler Implementation # Lambda function: error-handler def lambda_handler(event, context): error_info = event.get('error', {}) deployment_id = event.get('deployment_id') # Classify error type error_type = classify_error(error_info) if error_type == 'RETRYABLE': return { 'action': 'RETRY', 'delay_seconds': calculate_backoff(event), 'max_attempts': get_max_attempts(error_info) } elif error_type == 'ROLLBACK_REQUIRED': return { 'action': 'ROLLBACK', 'deployment_id': deployment_id, 'rollback_strategy': 'IMMEDIATE' } else: return { 'action': 'FAIL', 'error_details': error_info, 'notification_required': True } Rollback Mechanisms (15 phÃºt) Rollback State Machine Enhanced state machine vá»›i rollback capability:
{ "HandleFailure": { "Type": "Task", "Resource": "arn:aws:lambda:us-east-1:ACCOUNT:function:error-handler", "Next": "DecideAction" }, "DecideAction": { "Type": "Choice", "Choices": [ { "Variable": "$.action", "StringEquals": "ROLLBACK", "Next": "InitiateRollback" }, { "Variable": "$.action", "StringEquals": "RETRY", "Next": "WaitBeforeRetry" } ], "Default": "SendFailureNotification" }, "InitiateRollback": { "Type": "Parallel", "Branches": [ { "StartAt": "RollbackOrderService", "States": { "RollbackOrderService": { "Type": "Task", "Resource": "arn:aws:lambda:us-east-1:ACCOUNT:function:rollback-service", "Parameters": { "service_name": "order-service", "action": "ROLLBACK_TO_PREVIOUS" }, "End": true } } }, { "StartAt": "RollbackPaymentService", "States": { "RollbackPaymentService": { "Type": "Task", "Resource": "arn:aws:lambda:us-east-1:ACCOUNT:function:rollback-service", "Parameters": { "service_name": "payment-service", "action": "ROLLBACK_TO_PREVIOUS" }, "End": true } } } ], "Next": "ValidateRollback" }, "ValidateRollback": { "Type": "Task", "Resource": "arn:aws:lambda:us-east-1:ACCOUNT:function:health-checker", "Parameters": { "validate_rollback": true }, "Next": "SendRollbackNotification" } } Rollback Lambda Function # Lambda function: rollback-service def lambda_handler(event, context): service_name = event['service_name'] action = event['action'] if action == 'ROLLBACK_TO_PREVIOUS': # Get previous stable version previous_version = get_previous_stable_version(service_name) # Update ECS service to previous version rollback_result = rollback_ecs_service( service_name=service_name, target_version=previous_version ) # Wait for rollback completion wait_for_rollback_completion(service_name) # Validate rollback success health_status = validate_service_health(service_name) return { 'service': service_name, 'rollback_status': 'SUCCESS', 'previous_version': previous_version, 'health_status': health_status, 'rollback_duration': rollback_result['duration'] } return {'error': 'Unknown rollback action'} def get_previous_stable_version(service_name): # Query ECS service deployment history deployments = ecs_client.describe_services( cluster='restaurant-cluster', services=[service_name] ) # Find last successful deployment for deployment in deployments['services'][0]['deployments']: if deployment['status'] == 'STABLE': return deployment['taskDefinition'] raise Exception(f"No stable version found for {service_name}") Test Rollback Scenarios #
